taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Poa abbreviata R. Br. subsp. abbreviata

bio:treatment.description: Ligules 0.4-1.7(3) mm, apices truncate to acute. Spikelets not bulbiferous; florets normal. Calluses glabrous, rarely webbed; lemmas with keels and marginal veins short- to long-villous, hairs extending along 5/6 of the keel, intercostal regions softly puberulent to short-villous; anthers 0.2-0.8 mm. 2n = 42.
bio:treatment.discussion: Poa abbreviata subsp. abbreviata is a common high arctic subspecies that also grows at scattered locations in the Brooks Range, Alaska, and in the Rocky Mountains of the Northwest Territories. It has a circumpolar distribution, but is not common in the Eurasian continental arctic.
